roles: Advisor to the Minister of Foreign Affairs

supporting_evidence.quote: From 1974 to 1977, he was an advisor to the Minister of Foreign Affairs.
He was appointed an advisor to the Minister for Foreign Affairs of Egypt in 1974 and served in that post until 1977.

roles: Director of the Department of International Organizations
Head of the Department of International Organizations

supporting_evidence.quote: From 1977 to 1981 and again from 1983 to 1990, he was the Director of the Department of International Organizations at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
He then became director of the Department of International Organizations,
In 1983 he was appointed Ambassador to India and returned to Egypt in 1986 to head the Department of International Organizations.

roles: Permanent Representative of Egypt to the United Nations

supporting_evidence.quote: In 1990, he was promoted Permanent Representative of Egypt to the United Nations.
Egyptian Ambassador to the United Nations, 1990–1991
In 1990, he was appointed Permanent Representative of Egypt to the UN.
Minister of Foreign Affairs in office 20 May 1991 – 15 May 2001
Previously he served in the government of Egypt as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1991 to 2001.
He was named Minister of Foreign Affairs by Prime Minister Atef Sedki on 20 May 1991.
Minister of Foreign Affairs, 1991–2001
He became Minister of Foreign Affairs of Egypt from 1991 to 2001.
Amr Moussa... was the Secretary-General of the Arab League... from 1 June 2001 to 1 July 2011.
He was minister until 15 May 2001 when he was elected as Secretary-General of the Arab League.
On 15 May 2001, Moussa was selected as Secretary-General of the League of Arab States and took office on 1 June 2001.
Secretary-General of the Arab League, 2001–2011
After serving as Egypt's Foreign Minister from 1991 to 2001, he served as the Secretary General of the Arab League.
In May 2001 he was appointed as Secretary General of the League of Arab States.

organization_name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Egypt

supporting_evidence.quote: H.E. Amr Moussa joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Egypt in 1958.
He worked in several Egyptian missions including Egypt’s Embassy in Switzerland and the Egyptian Mission to the UN from 1958 to 1972.
